intro: Alstroemeria angustifolia var. intermedia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved alstroemeria, is a perennial flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of vibrant, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower. The species is noted for its resilience and ability to adapt to various growing conditions.
